name: Casa Angelina

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 5 nights at the Casa this past may. The hotel has some of the most amazing views you will find anywhere along the coast. The hotel was ultra modern, and thus very much to our liking. The staff was exceptional. We really enjoyed staying Praiano, away from the tourist mayhem of Positano. The restaurant across the street (i believe its called La Strada) was incredible Do get the table on the roof top terrace. Its a family run hotel, and all the food is home made. We ate there 3 times, and tried many of the dishes on the menu. Everything was very very good.
reviews.title: Great time in Praiano!!!

reviews.text: My only complaint with the hotel is the noise outside the rooms in the mornings. The rooms have zero soundproofing. When the cleaning staff starts doing their rounds in the morning, you can hear everything. The rooms themselves are fantastic. I am not sure why they would neglect something as important as soundproofing.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall an incredible stay. Will deffinetly be back.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay - Great Restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Casa Angelina is a clean, modern, and luxurious hotel that sets itself apart from other hotels on the Amalfi coast. I recently stayed for 4 nights in late May. We had booked the Canopy room but were upgraded to a larger room with a balcony upon arrival. The hotel is exactly like the pictures portray. I found the service to be excellent as a couple small problems we had were immediately responded to (the phone was hung up and someone was at our door within 2 minutes). Recent complaints from a prior post regarding sound issues and lighting were not found to be true. I'm typically very conscious of sound and we did not hear anything despite being on the first level right by a high traffic area for maintenance people. what made this hotel so special, outside of its luxury and views, is its location in Praiano. the town is wonderful only a short 5 minute walk up the cliff (approx 50-75 steps). the stores and restaurants all seem to be family operated and thus provide a true feel for the italian culture (more so than touristy towns like Positano and Amalfi). for those concerned about the breakfast not being included, i suggest walking into town, purchasing hot/fresh croissants and/or anything else you need. i did this numerous times for under 5 euro for both my wife and i. in comparison to the over priced breakfast offered at the hotel, this method is much better both for price and quality of food. we did not eat the hotel restaurant for dinner because we thought the restaurants in Praiano and other towns would be superior.
reviews.title: Nice, but not perfect

likes.disliked: — Lack of soundproofing, harsh lighting in the bedrooms, high prices

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: as far as seeing other towns along the coast, the hotel provides a shuttle to positano for free. the bus is very easy to use for a return if you stay at night or any other time when the shuttle isn't running. Casa Angelina even set up a free trip to Ravello one night while we were there which was also very nice. the walk down to the "beach" is not worth it but you should try it once just to see. i used driveamalfi for transportation from the train station in naples. i highly recommend them and would suggest asking for robert if you do so. i wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to people in the future - it was an excellent stay.
reviews.title: easter weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent a week at Casa Angelina for our honeymoon and absolutely loved it. From the first moment we felt at home by the friendly staff. After a quick tour of the hotel we were shown to our room which had an incredible view (romantic view room). The decor was ultra modern which my husband and I loved. Everything was crisp and very clean.
reviews.title: Amazing week spent @ Casa Angelina

reviews.text: After arriving late in the afternoon we decided to take advantage of the room service and were not disappointed. The food was amazing.. The restaurant quality was also exceptional as was breakfast.. A choice of eggs, bacon, yogurt, fruit, cold meats, cheese........The choice seemed endless. Every meal we had at Casa Angelina was of the highest quality using fresh produce.
reviews.title: Beautiful and Amazing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The loaction of the hotel was also great. We hired a scooter and visited Positano and Amalfi. This is an excellent way to explore the area, it seemed much easier than travelling by car as the roads are very narrow and quite busy at times.
reviews.title: Booooring

reviews.text: The beach and pool area of the hotel also did not dissapoint. The beach is a little far down and getting back up the steps is a challenge but the area down there is great. Vincenzo, who was always there to offer drinks or food, was also great..,always happy to converse with my husband who enjoyed trying to practice his limited Italian with him.
reviews.title: A relaxing hotel with a good feel factor...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The most important thing to mention however is the staff. They truely made our stay very memorable. We were alsways greeted with a friendly smile and 'bona sera'. They always were there to cater to our every whim.
reviews.title: What a truly beautiful hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here on our honeymoon for a week in September. It is by far the best hotel we have ever stayed in.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel

likes.disliked: — Going down the hairpin bends of the hotel's drive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff cannot do enough to look after you, everyone is very friendly.
reviews.title: Paradise is... down the steps!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food is wonderful, we loved the breakfast buffet (including huge balls of mozzarella, and smoked salmon and scrambled eggs). Dinner was also excellent, whether we ate in the bar or in the main restaurant.
reviews.title: A conundrum
Beautiful and excellent in all areas
reviews.text: We had fresh towels twice a day, on our first night as it was our honeymoon the maid had put rose petals in the bath and drawn a heart on the bath mat in rose petals too. Chocolates and the next day's weather forecast on our pillow each night, even your slippers were put by the bed!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, we cannot recommend it highly enough.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel in an stunning part of Italy

reviews.text: We stayed here recently for 4 nights and had a wonderful time. The hotel is exquisite to look at and live in with everything in white and the most fabulous views along the coast including wonderful sunsets. More importantly for a hotel stay were the fantastic staff. Everyone was more than helpful and friendly, but not in corporate 'have a nice day' way but genuinely concerned with your wellbeing. The breakfast was great and a good selection given it is a relatively small hotel. We ate in everynight and the food was consistently excellent. Overall I highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: P.S. If you can afford it take the hotel motor launch out along the coast and enjoy the stunning scenery.
reviews.title: More Hit Than Miss......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I took ages in deciding if to stay at Casa Angelina due to some very mixed reviews below. I took a chance, and I'm glad I did. However, the negatives written elsewhere are true - as are the positives.
reviews.title: Loved this place

likes.liked: — views, statues and art placed about, the staff
likes.disliked: — had to take the hotel shuttle or a taxi to/from Positano

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I always knew Casa Angelina would appeal to me because I love white-washed modern buildings with scattered art work adding splashes of colour. I liked this building and the rooms, though I hated the artwork, but that's a personal matter.
reviews.title: stunning sunsets

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What is an absolute A+ about the design of this hotel is the huge windows all over the place. The designer had the sense to know that the view was more important than anything inside the hotel - and what a view. Stunning! From morning to night, in any kind of weather, the view captivates. And what is even better is that you get a view of Positano which is far better than actually visiting the place. We used the free hotel shuttle to go there and couldn't wait to get back to the tranquility of the hotel. Ditto for Amalfi. Positano and Amalfi were lovely charming places 50 years ago - now they are just tourist traps full of tat for sale, and they teach you nothing about Italy.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, average food

description: Barefoot Luxury on Italy's Amalfi Coast
